thread.title: Little Mix star Jade Thirlwall narrowly avoids X-rated fashion disaster on the Brit Awards 2017 red carpet
thread.title_full: Little Mix star Jade Thirlwall narrowly avoids X-rated fashion disaster on the Brit Awards 2017 red carpet

author: Joshua Haigh
title: Little Mix star Jade Thirlwall narrowly avoids X-rated fashion disaster on the Brit Awards 2017 red carpet
text:
Jade's outfit stole the show Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
It's set to be a big night for Little Mix at the Brit Awards. 
While the Black Magic band are hoping to win their first award, they're trying their best to get down the red carpet without any major mishaps. 
Jade Thirlwall almost fell victim to an embarrassing wardrobe malfunction thanks to her revealing red carpet gown that left little to the imagination. 
Showing off her stunningly long legs in the expensive-looking white silk gown, the strong winds in London threatened to show off a little more than she had bargained for. Jade had to hold her gown down (Photo: PA) Jade flashed more than a little leg in the risky outfit (Photo: PA) 
Jade was forced to hold down the front of her dress thanks to the sky-high thigh slip that risked giving her a major Marilyn Monroe moment in front of the paparazzi. 
She was quickly followed by the rest of her bandmates, Perrie Edwards, Leigh-Anne Pinnock and Jesy Nelson, who all looked gorgeous in similar red carpet ensembles ahead of their big performance. 
Fans in the UK can watch all the action on ITV with an exclusive broadcast, while Clara Amfo, Laura Jackson and Alice Levine will host live from the red carpet and backstage either side of the main show on ITV2. Jade was joined by her band mates on the red carpet (Photo: Rex Features) 
However, that's not all - the BRITs will also air live on YouTube at 7.30pm, which will be fronted by the platform's presenter-in-chief Casper Lee. 
Geoff Taylor, chief executive of the BPI & BRIT Awards said: "We are always looking for ways for The BRITs to reach as wide an audience as possible given the global interest and huge international artists taking part in the show. The band are performing tonight (Photo: Getty Images North America) 
"It’s really exciting for us that so many people around the world will get the chance to celebrate the UK’s biggest night in music live as it happens.”
